greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle where n-th row contains the smallest n positive integers (listed in order) with exactly n nonleading 0's in their binary representations.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..125 of triangle, flattened
example: Binary representations of the terms in the first few rows:
maple: A080791 := proc(n) local bdigs ; bdigs := convert(n,base,2) ; nops(bdigs)-add(i,i=bdigs) ; end: A131094 := proc(n) local a,i; a := [] ; i := 2^n ; while nops(a) < n do while A080791(i) <> n do i := i+1 ; od: a := [op(a),i] ; i := i+1 ; od: RETURN(a) ; end: seq(op(A131094(n)),n=1..10) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 17 2007
program: f v ws = ys : f (v + 1) ys where
ys = take v $ nub $ sort $ concatMap h ws
h z = [2 * z, 4 * z + 1, 4 * z' + b] where (z', b) = divMod z 2
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Jun 14 2007
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 17 2007
